page.title: 05BEAFORD; A WEEKEND ACTIVITY
page.content: Most weekends we go scrambling, which is a motor-bicycle sport. It is a fast moving sport. The course is mud or dust, with jumps and hills. On Sunday 9th. June, 1985, Dad and I went to a scramble at Doddiscombleigh, near Exeter. The course was rough and dusty, with a stream running through the track that made it a bit boggy. There was a very steep hill and some riders fell off. Children take part in this sport, using suitably powered bikes, and are grouped by age:- 5 to 7 years; 8 to 10; 11 to 13; 14 to 15; and 16 to 17. Winners of races receive a trophy. When you are old enough you can enter the men's motor-bike races. A brand new motor-bike, with a 500 c.c. engine, would cost about Â£1500.
